title: An elegy, on the deplorable, and never enough to be lamented death, of the illustrious, and serene Charles the II. King of Great-Britain, France, and Ireland, &c. who departed this life, (on Friday the 6th. of February, between 11 and 12. of the clock, in the forenoon: and was interr'd at Westminster, the 14th. of the same month, being the 55th year of his age, 1684/5.
author: Ker, Patrick, fl. 1691.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed by George Croom, at the sign of the Blue-Ball in Thames-street, over against Baynard's Castle.,
